001package imagingbook.lib.filter.linear;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
004
005/**
006 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
007 * 
008 * @author WB
009 * @version 2020/12/29
010 */
011public class GaussianKernel2D extends Kernel2D {
012        
013        public GaussianKernel2D(double sigmaX, double sigmaY) {
014                super(makeGaussKernel2D(sigmaX, sigmaY));
015        }
016        
017        public GaussianKernel2D(double sigma) {
018                super(makeGaussKernel2D(sigma, sigma));
019        }
020
021        /**
022         * Creates and returns a 2D Gaussian filter kernel large enough
023         * to avoid truncation effects. The associated array is odd-sized in
024         * both dimensions.
025         * The returned kernel is normalized.
026         * 
027         * @param sigmaX the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in x-direction
028         * @param sigmaY the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian in y-direction
029         * @return the Gaussian filter kernel
030         */
031        public static float[][] makeGaussKernel2D(double sigmaX, double sigmaY){
032                final int radX = (int) Math.ceil(GaussianKernel1D.SIZE_FACTOR * sigmaX);
033                final int radY = (int) Math.ceil(GaussianKernel1D.SIZE_FACTOR * sigmaY);
034                final int sizeX = radX + radX + 1;
035                final int sizeY = radY + radY + 1;
036
037                final float[][] kernel = new float[sizeX][sizeY]; //center cell = kernel[rad][rad]
038                final double sigmaX2 = (sigmaX > 0.1) ? sqr(sigmaX) : 0.1;
039                final double sigmaY2 = (sigmaY > 0.1) ? sqr(sigmaY) : 0.1;
040                
041                for (int i = 0; i < sizeY; i++) {
042                        final double  b = sqr(radY - i) / (2 * sigmaY2);
043                        for (int j = 0; j < sizeX; j++) {
044                                final double a = sqr(radX - j) / (2 * sigmaX2);
045                                double g = Math.exp(-(a + b));
046                                kernel[i][j] = (float) g;
047                        }
048                }
049                return normalize(kernel);       // we normalize just in case
050        }
051}
